INAYA Putri Bali
8.8 Excellent
Based on 1391 reviews

I came at 12pm and i need to wait till 3 pm. Buat i see so many guest can check in right time. And i see all new guest get the wet towel from staff hotel.

BUT i dont get that, i dont know why (maybe because im local guest with brown skin). For the room, bathroom so great, aircon so noisy, interior room so boring. And sink in shower so bad. For facilities, pool so good, beach nice. There's no fitness center in here. They hv a chapel, but they lock it access to there. Cmon when people just want to take pic with phone, how people outside know that u have a chapel if u do like that. For breakfast, so many variation, buat when im ask a small plate to keep my sppon and fork,they dont give me till im finish my breakfast. For staff, from start i stay there until check out, only a gardener who greeting me. And another staff never said anykind greeting to me. (Again localguest syndrom) When im check out , i want to ask boogey to parking area, but staff in front lobby just ignored me. Maybe because they think im not look like a guest in here. Poor u inaya

Show more
muhammad , Indonesia
Legian Beach Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 1229 reviews

Had a wonderful time with our 2 and half year old child. communication with staff was a bit hit n miss - but - if you expect a little bit of mis understand every now and then - it's a great place to stay.

I do hope they improve after our room wasn't serviced all day until midnight after explaining to them all day (approx 7 phone calls - every time we went to our room after returning) our room hadn't been serviced - eventually someone understood. :-) , we ate at there restaurant twice, one occasion we ordered a pineapple pizza and ended up with pepperoni, other night we asked for a speedy meal as son was a bit restless, we waited 45 mins for entree and 1hr for mains. I lost weight chasing my 2 yr old - not all bad, wife was furious. Our response to frustration - 'Have a good life'. I personally wasn't impressed, however a lot of staff did a wonderful job - reason for high rating - don't want one section of the hotel to ruin the whole experience, we stay there for 9 nights, enjoyed the experience. We were treated with respect and enjoyed and experiences eating out at other hotels in the area. Great pools, kids pool as well - down side for us with a child, there is a adults only pool with swim up bar. Great gardens, close to beach, good breakfast, friendly staff (but not as genuine as other places), staff helpful when convenient (but can not speak english when convenient also). Surprisingly, I would recommend this place, however, I wouldn't recommend the restaurant, but saying this, I hope they do improve as it is a fantastic location and has a lot of potential. Enjoy your holiday in Bali

Show more
Wade , Australia
Inna Grand Bali Beach Hotel
7.2 Very good
Based on 1310 reviews

Hotel great location, poorly run, dirty mouldy pool I used once green algae need a good scrub and acid treatment.

First room old dirty smelt like sewer demanded another room 2nd room better wall safe didn't work locking handle came off when we to set up the safe code pad faulty. Power points don't work making hard to charge laptops and phones. Safe was replaced at 130 at night. Shuttle bus never available over a klm walk to main gate local shops. No blue taxis forced to use their hotel cars at 3 times local blue taxis rate hotel is like a prison or walk a klm in the heat of the day. This hotel is only 3klm from the main Sanur area but is like you locked out from it. It is the largest hotel in Bali cover over 40 acres and was a 5 star hotel it is running down to a 2 star in my opinion time wake up and remember the words service ,maintaince and cleaning. The only person who showed us high quality service and assistance was Dory who went out of his to help straighten out all of the short comings of this hotel. We were for a friend's wedding and we're in and out of this hotel many times a day preparing this hotel made our life total he'll. They even refused entry to our taxi we had organized and paid for daily rate on the day of the wedding . forcing us to walk to the main gate at 1200 in our good clothes going to the wedding or pay 6000rp just because they did want use the shuttle buggy.

Show more
john , Australia
Kuta Paradiso Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 1997 reviews

Spending almost a week with my family. We checked in late night. Airport transfer was provided by Hotel, and was fabulous.

Days before our arrival, we were requesting a good room since we are staying for long period. However, we were given a bad room with lot of dust on parquette/floor, noisy room from motorcycle passing since balcony does not have proper insulation, bad AC. Our baby did not able to sleep due to these conditions and we did not feel comfortable at all. Bed was also bad. It will 'sink' your body. We made complaints in the morning and luckily there was one better room available. Located near Airport. Traffic is one thing to be considered to reach the hotel from your tour trips. There are many local shops, restaurants, malls surrounding the hotel within walking distance. Kuta beach is very near the hotel. Suggestion to hotel: Do not rent room that are not in proper condition. Have proper QA. You are 5* rating and MUST consistently showing your reputation.

Show more
Johanes , Indonesia
The Anvaya Beach Resort - Bali
8.8 Excellent
Based on 136 reviews

New Hotel of Santika Group. Nice modern style, friendly Staff. Garden nice Trees still a bit small but that will improve.

Rooms are modern an nice, with a lot of luggage a little small. Breakfast very good, a lot of asian stuff, western style could be a bit more (jam, cold meat aso.) For Bali a little disapointing were the Fruits no Papaya, Banana, Pineapple... just a few Watermelons and Salak, there is definitly room for improvement. The Hotel still has Sandbeach which is not given in Tuban Area.

Show more
Ulrich , Switzerland
The Bandha Hotel & Suites
9.2 Exceptional
Based on 254 reviews

Overall, I was impressed with this hotel. Staff were wonderful, very friendly and curteous. I arrived at the hotel at 10.

30 am and asked if I can check in early. The concierge was very kind and told me that my room would be prioritized. I was able to get my room about 25 minutes later. The hotel is located next to Balik Niksoma and Ossotel, with its own semi private beach in the bustling Legian area. The room (junior suite) was huge, with huge bathroom. The bath room alone was approx. 20m2 in size, with big bathtub, spacious shower and twin sink. The room was equipped with a large sofa bed. Food was quite delicious, although breakfast spread could be improved. Swimming pool was big, with kids pool and jacuzzi available. All in all, I love this hotel eventhough it is not fully completed yet. My suggestion is for the hotel to add kids activities room, which I believe would be a very much welcomed addition for families with young children.

Show more
LANANG , Indonesia
Hotel Vila Lumbung
7.9 Very good
Based on 658 reviews

Big spacious clean Balinese bungalows In a good location with only 10 min walking distance to beach and shopping 15 mins.

The staff were so lovely. (Especially Henny thank you for your wonderful service). Love the little extras in the outdoor bathroom like the body wash, hand creams, soaps, shampoo, shavers and shave cream, toothpaste and tooth brush. Great food ( Vietnamese rice paper rolls... Yummy) and cocktails at the pool bar. Much nicer than the bungalows at Legian beach hotel that are half the size more expensive and no outdoor bathroom. The day spa was not so good for me. I got the ultimate package they didn't give me the armotherapy bath I paid for just a shower inside with no reason. The massage and scrub was rough and sloppy, although the facial was lovely. I recommend walking up the road to the amazing Santara day spa no. 1 on trip advisor (wow this place is good!)

Show more
Natalie , Australia
Grand Barong Resort Bali Managed by Soscomma
8.5 Excellent
Based on 999 reviews

AN EXCEPTIONAL HOTEL IN KUTA WITH ​EXCELLENT STAFF !!!!! Had a great stay at Grand Barong​ !​!​!​ Such a beautiful hotel it is and could not fault it one bit.

This hotel is in a great location in Kuta which is right in the middle of Poppies Lane II. Two great pools and very welcoming to their guests. We highly recommend if you love to stay in Kuta. All the staff were friendly and helpful attending to our every need. I found they remembered your name and were very polite when you passed them. Grand Barong is a very clean and excellent hotel in Kuta. We would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in the heart of Kuta. ​This hotel has 2 nice pools. Their lagoon pool is fantastic and very sociable. I checked all types of rooms for our future visit and fond all rooms are great. Breakfast buffet was very nice which we enjoyed very much. Complimentary Internet with very good connection. Thanks to to all the staffs and a very special thanks to Ms. Agung Dewi, Sales Executive of Grand Barong Resort. As a business man I always travel around the world. Some time my wife also join with me. We checked in Grand Barong Resort beginning June 2017. After 2 days I had to go another place for my official tour. Before I went I informed the hotel staffs specially Ms. Agung Dewi, to look after my wife while I will be out of Bali. I am very very happy to say that after my departure from the Grand Barong hotel Ms. Agung Dewi took excellent care of my wife. She checked every now and then - if my wife needs any thing. After her office hours she took her to different places and show her around Bali. This is some thing extra ordinary care - you do not expect from any hotel officer. We like to pass our very special thanks to Ms. Agung Dewi for all her great support and company to my wife while I was out of Bali for few days. Again Thank you dear Ms. Agung Dewi !!!! We strongly recommend this hotel. We will surely coming back again...may be we have to come back for Ms. M

Show more
MEHEDI , Bangladesh
Bisma Eight Ubud
9.2 Exceptional
Based on 326 reviews

I booked the Forest Suite and was given room 331 which is located at the end of the corridor. There are 3 floors of Forest Suites and this room is located on the third floor below the infinity swimming pool.

As mentioned by the staff named Trisna who attended to us, it is the best room among all Forest Suite as it has an unblocked view of the Ubud forest and oh my, we fell in love immediately the moment we entered the room. Despite the room located just below the pool, there were no noise heard at all except the sound of the water from the valley below. The interior design of the room was carefully planned and executed. There is a rustic touch to the bali concept of the room but without being too traditional. The room is too comfortable to even go out and explore Ubud.I spent hours in the toilet all thanks to the Japanese bath that I was able to soak in with the bath salt provided by the hotel. We spent our days outside of the hotel to get dinner and we quickly come back to the hotel. The rest of the time, we were either in the hotel or chilling at the infinity swimming pool located at the rooftop. Breakfast was ala-carte with choices that are hard to make. Tried different breakfast choices throughout our stay and not even one disappoints us. There is room service so one of the days, we had our breakfast sent to the room. The hotel staffs are beyond wonderful. No communication problems at all as they speak good english and also their attitude towards guests are wonderful. They were able to rent motorbikes for us on one of the days and also enquired the price for a trip to bali night safari. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to everyone who wants a quiet and relaxing getaway. Most of the time, we spent our time in the hotel because the room comfort and standard is top-notch, it was hard to leave as well. Totally worth staying here. Looking forward to staying here again and experience the 'heaven-on-earth' feeling again.

Show more
Ili , Singapore
H Sovereign Bali Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 1138 reviews

I stayed here two different times within the same trip- the night I arrived and the night before I left Bali.

I had a good experience the first night which is why I rebooked- but I will not return after the second time. But first- it's a clean hotel in a good location close to the airport. The breakfast was just ok- they clearly had an egg station but was not running when I was there for bfast- maybe I was there too early? Semi cold noodles but good breakfst sushi and really decent coffee machine which which impressed me. The food at the cafe in the lobby and the japanese restaurant was really good, fresh and delicious if a little pricey. The spa is luxurious, priced well above what you should pay for in Bali but beautiful rooms, nice ambiance. I feel there was probably more up there but I didn't get the chance to explore more fully. The pool looked really nice but was too chilly for me to go in, there were plenty of other brave souls in there though! In general the staff were polite but not overly helpful. For instance, at check in it would only take 20 seconds to mention about the facilities at the hotel- where to find the pool, spa, what time and where bfast is etc. Also if they had of told me there was a free airport shuttle that would have saved me some time and money... They emailed me the day after I had checked out to let me know about it- too late! Anyway the beds are really comfy and showers are great. The first room I was in was a little noisy at first but I was so tired that it didn't bother me. I wont go in to too much detail about the dramas on my second visit but there was a problem with my booking apparently and despite my showing evidence (email confirmation from agoda) of exactly what I had booked the staff were insisting that had to either pay extra money or leave... Eventually I thought we got it sorted and they let me check in but then once up in my room the phone calls started asking me who I spoke to about this issue (wanting staff members n

Show more
Katherine , Australia
Jambuluwuk Seminyak Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 54 reviews

Where do I start. We had bad luck with this one. Booked for 5 nights and after 4 days of a string of ongoing issues we tapped out and booked somewhere else.

Moral of the story if you dont have time to read the rest of the review below is that there are plenty of better, cleaner places in Bali where the staff will truly go the extra mile to make every part of your stay extra special! Rooms are spacious, but not well maintained. From door locks and safety deposit boxes not working to toilets clogging up and the smell of sewage engulfing the room when the aircon is left off. This place has potential, but in my opinion ruined by the lack of attention to detail. Our room had not been cleaned for 2 days. The same mess we saw when we came into the room, was there two days later – despite complaining. Dishes, glasses and cutlery from room service dot the floors of the hotel and aren’t picked up promptly. We ordered room service and the dishes were still on the floor in front of our room a day later being mauled by ants. We wasted a lot of time waiting for maintenance people to fix things in our room so we could use the basic amenities. The balcony was exceptionally dirty. Breakfast is interesting. The quality of food is poor. We had young teens serve breakfast in an appalling manor. Ask for two sunny-side eggs and you get an egg-pancake with exploded yoke seeping over your plate. There is no care given to service in the restaurant. Breakfast ends at 10:30 but if you haven’t gotten in by 9:30 you risk getting the remnants of the service with no opportunity for them to replace what’s on the buffet menu for the day. On the last day there seemed to be a change of staff and the restaurant just worked better. Quality of output improved, but it was a little too late for us. Despite the reception staff being exceptionally polite and welcoming - the word sorry is used far too frequently in hope that you’ll just forget the issue and keep quiet. When eventually we decid

Show more
Sebastien , Malta
Visesa Ubud Resort
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 149 reviews

From the moment we arrived, the staff was friendly and wanted to make sure we enjoyed our stay. The property is beautiful.

The villas with private pools, lush green plants everywhere, organic gardens, beautiful temple on property, tours and activities, ducks/cows/roosters, nice public pool and fountains, bar, delicious food, relaxing spa...all of it was wonderful!! Breakfast every morning was great, with a combination of buffet items and fresh ordered items too. Coffees were fresh and they also have fresh juices. Daily room cleaning, pool cleaning and turndown service were all great, and the staff were all friendly. We had our laundry done multiple times, and it always came back on time, clean, smelled great and folded nicely. It was a little pricey, but convenient and easy. The spa is located in the rice fields in beautiful cabanas, and the cafe with healthy drinks is a great addition to the relaxing experience. I had a massage and facial on a rainy afternoon, and highly recommend. The staff make sure you're comfortable and the products they use were fantastic! They have a nice outside gym and yoga mats too. The wifi is good throughout the property, but we had some issues with it in our villa. It would still work great in the cabana area, but sometimes would stop working in the bedroom. They have activities throughout the day, and I'd recommend the poolside pampering and the class to learn how to make Balinese offerings. They have a free shuttle to take you into Ubud city every two hours, which was convenient and easy to use. We highly recommend staying here, as it has been a wonderful experience and definitely the best hotel we've ever stayed at!! Thank you for a wonderful week, Royal Tulip Vesesa!

Show more
Kiel , United States
Griya Santrian a Beach Resort
8.4 Excellent
Based on 870 reviews

The majority of the Sanur hotels and resorts were built 25 to 50 years ago and Girya Santrain was built in 1970’s however it’s been updated several times since but the rooms still have a dated atmosphere.

The reason I mention this is because the majority of the beach front hotels in Sanur can’t be compared with the more modern hotels rooms elsewhere in Bali. It’s context, Sanur with its white sand and peaceful atmosphere is different to the hectic pace of the Kuta, Legian, Seminyak side where the hotels are more modern. Griya Santrain would be one the better beach front hotel/resorts with several pools, the pool bar looks like lots of fun and with direct access to the beach it a great spot. The gardens are well established and beautiful. A dated but a decent sized bathroom with separate shower and bathtub which is a blessing, the need to not get into the bathtub to have shower was certainly appreciated. Very comfortable bed and a selection of pillows with quality linen. Perfect! The “Pool View” room was great, but if you wanted peace and quiet I imagine the Garden View rooms would suit. The hotel restaurant set right on the beach is very nice however I think the hotel management should increase the budget of the kitchen… if you get my meaning. Breakfast, I guess it could be classed as equivalent to 3 star hotel. The morning coffee is either the brewed style or AUD$4.20 extra for a cappuccino which is equally as bad… skip the coffee and go to one of the other beach front hotels with a trained barista at the machine. In general, the food is below par of what is served elsewhere in Bali, why management doesn’t improve the situation is astonishing. They have good, friendly capable staff, the perfect location therefore why not make it the point of difference between other eateries in Sanur? Send the kitchen staff to some of the places in Seminyak. For breakfast and lunch “The Nook”, for dinner there are too many to mention. People do pay for a great meal and also retur

Show more
Marcel , Australia
Bounty Hotel
7.4 Very good
Based on 849 reviews

I had an amazing time at the Bounty. Definitely for the young at heart as the music was constantly pumping and the drinks were flowing.

But I loved that and although situated directly next to the pool, it was never too loud. I met an elderly lady there from Victoria who was definitely young at heart and appeared to enjoy the atmosphere. So it seems anyone can enjoy. One thing I wasn't pleased about was that my tattoo designs were thrown out. They were on my bedside table and when asked if they knew where they were or what happened to them they denied ever seeing them. A lesson learnt I guess. That aside I would recommend this hotel to anyone. A great place to meet people, centrally located and more than value for money. Btw if you want a great place to hang out, check out the small little bar across from the bounty. Serves great food and the guy who runs it "mad dog" always greets you with a smile and a card trick. It's on the opposite of the street from the Bounty!

Show more
Jason , Australia
Sulis Beach Hotel and Spa
8.7 Excellent
Based on 190 reviews

Sulis worked really well for us as we were looking for a place which could accomodate our family of 4 in one room.

The room was large, spacious and clean and fitted with modern amenities. My husband was very pleased with the amount of plug points available making it very convenient to charge phones, laptops etc. The bathroom was large and what I liked was that there was even a soap dispenser next to the toilet. The fridge was large and could accomodate alot. I was impressed most by the management and staff of the hotel as they went out of their way to accomodate every request and were very prompt in replying all correspondence. The breakfast was a set menu but had 3 options of American, Continental and Indonesian. The food was tasty and there was ample to eat. The hotel is just a few minutes walk to the Double Six beach which is a popular hangout. The hotel has a regular shuttle service to the beach. I rented a motorbike from a roadside shop right across to the hotel on Drupadi road. Don’t pay more than 50k rupiah per day if u staying more than 3 days. The bathroom is also huge - his and hers sinks, and toiletries from Bliss (Lemon & Sage). The inclusion of the following items in the bathroom is also evident of the thought that has gone into designing a home-away-from-home experience at the W - the facial wash/ scrub (also from Bliss), Listerine mouthwash, bubble bath and chocolate scrub (from the AWAY Spa), and even a mini loofah. The mini-bar is super well-stocked - some of the items on the tray for purchase included a cap, a SIM card and a tube of Berocca. In short, the room had everything we needed and more for a really really comfortable stay. Service at the W is also top notch, as was the food at Starfish Bloo. Location-wise, it was fantastic. Complimentary buggy rides are available if you need a lift to the main road and back. Right outside, there's no shortage of dining and spa options. We had breakfast at the Fat Turtle and Biku (about 1-2 mins down the road in the direction of Hu'u Villas), and Sisterfields was a short taxi ride away. There's also Sarong, Cafe Organic and a Vietnamese cafe down the row. Amo Spa is right across the road, and Re Day Spa is about a 3-min walk in the direction of Sardine/ Metis.

Everything was a mere walking distance from the place—my friend's go-to cafes, the market, Ubud Palace, etc. Plus there were quaint shops up and down the street where it's located so getting around was never dull. When we did finally check in, we were surprised to see how nice the pool area was (my friend's a blogger and she defo thought it was instagrammable). Our room was also quite comfortable and they always cleaned up after our embarrassing messy selves. They also provided bottled water everyday which is a big deal bec apparently they don't serve free house water at any of the cafes. PLUS FREE BREAKFAST. Our faves?The banana pancakes, nasi goreng and fresh juices! Definitely staying here again next time I'm in Ubud... which is probably gonna be soon and on the regular 😝

The hotel, consisting of mainly separate thatched bungalows, is well located 50 metres from Mushroom Bay beach, close to some good restaurants and is clean & well maintained.

The rooms are 3.6 x 3.6 metres (13.1m2) plus an outside Bali bathroom (2.2 x 3.5 metres = 7.7m2) & 2.0 x 3.6 (7.2m2) balcony (a total of 28m2 – slightly bigger than advertised), room safe, good sized fridge, 2 cups & 2 glasses, kettle, 1 litre jug of water, tea, coffee, whitener, sugar & soap replaced daily, reasonable beds & pillows, good airconditioner with ceiling fan, enough power points & no TV. Wardrobe space is at a premium but there were plenty of coat hangers. The free in-room internet is slow. The pool is great with 12 lounges & several chairs, enough for all guests & adds to the resort feel of the complex. Pool towels are supplied. The gardens are immaculate, ocean views are available from some rooms & the balcony is a good size with a couple of chairs & a table. It is the little things that impressed us - the friendly staff, mozzie coils lit every night on the balcony, rooms made up daily, good toilet paper & many other small things. The free breakfast was adequate & nice. The dining room supplies, at competitive prices, the usual western style food that all hotels supply. We prefer the warang Indonesian food that the locals eat. We would definitely return here.

The Pajar House was perfection in our eyes: Our romantic guesthouse had a balinese architecture mixed in with some more contemporary designs, surrounded by a lush garden.

We had an open concept kitchen, dined outside where we had delicious breakfast served to us everyday (your meals, whatever you chose, always came with fresh fruit juice, hot beverage of your choice and sliced fruits. We highly recommend their Nasi Goreng!). We had a big comfortable bed equipped with a mosquito net (although we never used it) and our bathroom was semi-open concept as well. I took a 30 minute shower that first night, giddy that I can go stargazing while showering and sitting in the loo. The shower head had good pressure and was hot. While we were not in the center of Ubud, their complimentary shuttle (running until 10 pm) made it a breeze to travel to town and back to the guesthouse. They provided us with a cellphone which we have used to contact the reception for anything we needed and to arrange shuttle pick ups and drop offs. From Ubud Center, it only took them 10 minutes to pick us up after we make the call. Their drop off and pick up point is at Ubud Palace. Amazing! I mean really you get the best of two worlds -- staying in a Balinese family compound close to the rice fields yet easy and quick access to all the action in town. I would recommend for light sleepers to pack a pair of ear plugs however, because the roosters start crowing way before sunrise! ;) However, it's part of the charm! The Pajar House is a family run business and really, their hospitality and warmth can't be beat. For example, I called them late at night asking if they had a kettle I could use for tea, and reception immediately sent someone to bring us a thermos of hot water. Truly -- I felt like it was home away from home, only better. Highly recommended!

ap inn apartments are well located just off poppies 1. the apartments are basic but comfortable. we stayed in a one bedroom which is quite spacious but would be more accurately described as a studio as the bedroom is not a separate room.

there are no cupboards or shelves in the bathroom at all but lots of cupboards in the kitchenette. there was a full size fridge and microwave but only a couple of plates and a bit of cutlery. you could not prepare a meal in the microwave but it is handy to reheat things. breakfast was included in the room charge and was a choice from four options. other meals could also be purchased. the rooftop pool area does not have any shade at all but the pool itself is quite nice. the penthouse apartment is also on the rooftop and i'm glad we didn't book it. it is only a few meters from the edge of the pool and there is a lounge area right outside the penthouse door which is not for the penthouse but is used by anyone. our apartment was on the first floor near the stairwell and we were woken up every morning between 6 - 7 by the loud voices of staff talking (or yelling) to each other in the reception area on the ground floor. my comment to them that they are very loud did not make any difference. the location if great, staff are friendly and the apartment is certainly adequate however the overall impression is that everything is done as cheaply as possible (eg. no hand towels, coffee not replaced, no soap, dishcloth or tea towel provided although there is a kitchen sink, lights turned off in hallways, etc)

More about Bali

Bali is a world away from the rest of Indonesia, and a longtime favorite with international travelers. Surfers have been coming here since the 1930s, but it wasn't until the 1960s that surfing vacations to Bali became the popular thing to do. Today, the trend continues and Bali sees as many surfers as it does affluent resort tourists.

Indonesia may have the world's largest Muslim population, but Bali fosters its own distinct culture. Hinduism has flourished here for nearly 2,000 years. Away from the beaches are fascinating Hindu temples, cultural exhibitions, terraced rice fields, and colorful festivals.

Kuta is the busiest resort district in Bali, featuring some of the top luxury hotels in Bali. Behind the main waterfront is a spread of budget guesthouses that are still within easy walking distance of the beach. From here it's a short trip by taxi or rented motorbike to Uluwatu, a massive limestone peninsula jutting out in the sea. Tourists visit Uluwatu to see the temple, go surfing, or watch the sunset over the majestic cliffs.

Legian is another must-see, as it offers an excellent surf along with exciting nightlife along the beach. Life in Legian begins and ends on the beach. Surf shops give lessons by day, and then give way to lively bars and live music venues after sunset. There is a reason that Bali is often referred to as paradise, and much of it is evidenced by a visit to the many beaches.

Poor u inaya Show more muhammad , Indonesia Legian Beach Hotel 8.1 Excellent Based on 1229 reviews Had a wonderful time with our 2 and half year old child. communication with staff was a bit hit n miss - but - if you expect a little bit of mis understand every now and then - it's a great place to stay. I do hope they improve after our room wasn't serviced all day until midnight after explaining to them all day (approx 7 phone calls - every time we went to our room after returning) our room hadn't been serviced - eventually someone understood. :-) , we ate at there restaurant twice, one occasion we ordered a pineapple pizza and ended up with pepperoni, other night we asked for a speedy meal as son was a bit restless, we waited 45 mins for entree and 1hr for mains. I lost weight chasing my 2 yr old - not all bad, wife was furious. Our response to frustration - 'Have a good life'. I personally wasn't impressed, however a lot of staff did a wonderful job - reason for high rating - don't want one section of the hotel to ruin the whole experience, we stay there for 9 nights, enjoyed the experience. We were treated with respect and enjoyed and experiences eating out at other hotels in the area. Great pools, kids pool as well - down side for us with a child, there is a adults only pool with swim up bar. Great gardens, close to beach, good breakfast, friendly staff (but not as genuine as other places), staff helpful when convenient (but can not speak english when convenient also). Surprisingly, I would recommend this place, however, I wouldn't recommend the restaurant, but saying this, I hope they do improve as it is a fantastic location and has a lot of potential. Show more john , Australia Kuta Paradiso Hotel 8 Very good Based on 1997 reviews Spending almost a week with my family. We checked in late night. Airport transfer was provided by Hotel, and was fabulous. Days before our arrival, we were requesting a good room since we are staying for long period. However, we were given a bad room with lot of dust on parquette/floor, noisy room from motorcycle passing since balcony does not have proper insulation, bad AC. Our baby did not able to sleep due to these conditions and we did not feel comfortable at all. Bed was also bad. It will 'sink' your body. We made complaints in the morning and luckily there was one better room available. Located near Airport. Traffic is one thing to be considered to reach the hotel from your tour trips. There are many local shops, restaurants, malls surrounding the hotel within walking distance. Kuta beach is very near the hotel. Suggestion to hotel: Do not rent room that are not in proper condition. Have proper QA. You are 5* rating and MUST consistently showing your reputation. Show more Johanes , Indonesia The Anvaya Beach Resort - Bali 8.8 Excellent Based on 136 reviews New Hotel of Santika Group. Nice modern style, friendly Staff. Garden nice Trees still a bit small but that will improve. Rooms are modern an nice, with a lot of luggage a little small. Breakfast very good, a lot of asian stuff, western style could be a bit more (jam, cold meat aso.) For Bali a little disapointing were the Fruits no Papaya, Banana, Pineapple... just a few Watermelons and Salak, there is definitly room for improvement. The Hotel still has Sandbeach which is not given in Tuban Area. Show more Ulrich , Switzerland The Bandha Hotel & Suites 9.2 Exceptional Based on 254 reviews Overall, I was impressed with this hotel. Staff were wonderful, very friendly and curteous. I arrived at the hotel at 10. 30 am and asked if I can check in early. The concierge was very kind and told me that my room would be prioritized. I was able to get my room about 25 minutes later. The hotel is located next to Balik Niksoma and Ossotel, with its own semi private beach in the bustling Legian area. The room (junior suite) was huge, with huge bathroom. The bath room alone was approx. 20m2 in size, with big bathtub, spacious shower and twin sink. The room was equipped with a large sofa bed. Food was quite delicious, although breakfast spread could be improved. Swimming pool was big, with kids pool and jacuzzi available. All in all, I love this hotel eventhough it is not fully completed yet. My suggestion is for the hotel to add kids activities room, which I believe would be a very much welcomed addition for families with young children. Show more LANANG , Indonesia Hotel Vila Lumbung 7.9 Very good Based on 658 reviews Big spacious clean Balinese bungalows In a good location with only 10 min walking distance to beach and shopping 15 mins. The staff were so lovely. (Especially Henny thank you for your wonderful service). Love the little extras in the outdoor bathroom like the body wash, hand creams, soaps, shampoo, shavers and shave cream, toothpaste and tooth brush. Great food ( Vietnamese rice paper rolls... Yummy) and cocktails at the pool bar. Much nicer than the bungalows at Legian beach hotel that are half the size more expensive and no outdoor bathroom. The day spa was not so good for me. I got the ultimate package they didn't give me the armotherapy bath I paid for just a shower inside with no reason. The massage and scrub was rough and sloppy, although the facial was lovely. I recommend walking up the road to the amazing Santara day spa no. 1 on trip advisor (wow this place is good!) Show more Natalie , Australia Grand Barong Resort Bali Managed by Soscomma 8.5 Excellent Based on 999 reviews AN EXCEPTIONAL HOTEL IN KUTA WITH EXCELLENT STAFF !!!!! Had a great stay at Grand Barong ! ! ! Such a beautiful hotel it is and could not fault it one bit. This hotel is in a great location in Kuta which is right in the middle of Poppies Lane II. Two great pools and very welcoming to their guests. We highly recommend if you love to stay in Kuta. All the staff were friendly and helpful attending to our every need. I found they remembered your name and were very polite when you passed them. Grand Barong is a very clean and excellent hotel in Kuta. We would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in the heart of Kuta. This hotel has 2 nice pools. Their lagoon pool is fantastic and very sociable. I checked all types of rooms for our future visit and fond all rooms are great. Breakfast buffet was very nice which we enjoyed very much. Complimentary Internet with very good connection. Thanks to to all the staffs and a very special thanks to Ms. Agung Dewi, Sales Executive of Grand Barong Resort. As a business man I always travel around the world. Some time my wife also join with me. We checked in Grand Barong Resort beginning June 2017. After 2 days I had to go another place for my official tour. Before I went I informed the hotel staffs specially Ms. Agung Dewi, to look after my wife while I will be out of Bali. I am very very happy to say that after my departure from the Grand Barong hotel Ms. Agung Dewi took excellent care of my wife. She checked every now and then - if my wife needs any thing. After her office hours she took her to different places and show her around Bali. This is some thing extra ordinary care - you do not expect from any hotel officer. We like to pass our very special thanks to Ms. Agung Dewi for all her great support and company to my wife while I was out of Bali for few days. Again Thank you dear Ms. Agung Dewi !!!! We strongly recommend this hotel. We will surely coming back again...may be we have to come back for Ms. M Show more MEHEDI , Bangladesh Bisma Eight Ubud 9.2 Exceptional Based on 326 reviews I booked the Forest Suite and was given room 331 which is located at the end of the corridor. There are 3 floors of Forest Suites and this room is located on the third floor below the infinity swimming pool. As mentioned by the staff named Trisna who attended to us, it is the best room among all Forest Suite as it has an unblocked view of the Ubud forest and oh my, we fell in love immediately the moment we entered the room. Despite the room located just below the pool, there were no noise heard at all except the sound of the water from the valley below. The interior design of the room was carefully planned and executed. There is a rustic touch to the bali concept of the room but without being too traditional. The room is too comfortable to even go out and explore Ubud.I spent hours in the toilet all thanks to the Japanese bath that I was able to soak in with the bath salt provided by the hotel. We spent our days outside of the hotel to get dinner and we quickly come back to the hotel. The rest of the time, we were either in the hotel or chilling at the infinity swimming pool located at the rooftop. Breakfast was ala-carte with choices that are hard to make. Tried different breakfast choices throughout our stay and not even one disappoints us. There is room service so one of the days, we had our breakfast sent to the room. The hotel staffs are beyond wonderful. No communication problems at all as they speak good english and also their attitude towards guests are wonderful. They were able to rent motorbikes for us on one of the days and also enquired the price for a trip to bali night safari. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to everyone who wants a quiet and relaxing getaway. Most of the time, we spent our time in the hotel because the room comfort and standard is top-notch, it was hard to leave as well. Totally worth staying here. Looking forward to staying here again and experience the 'heaven-on-earth' feeling again. I had a good experience the first night which is why I rebooked- but I will not return after the second time. But first- it's a clean hotel in a good location close to the airport. The breakfast was just ok- they clearly had an egg station but was not running when I was there for bfast- maybe I was there too early? Semi cold noodles but good breakfst sushi and really decent coffee machine which which impressed me. The food at the cafe in the lobby and the japanese restaurant was really good, fresh and delicious if a little pricey. The spa is luxurious, priced well above what you should pay for in Bali but beautiful rooms, nice ambiance. I feel there was probably more up there but I didn't get the chance to explore more fully. The pool looked really nice but was too chilly for me to go in, there were plenty of other brave souls in there though! In general the staff were polite but not overly helpful. For instance, at check in it would only take 20 seconds to mention about the facilities at the hotel- where to find the pool, spa, what time and where bfast is etc. Also if they had of told me there was a free airport shuttle that would have saved me some time and money... They emailed me the day after I had checked out to let me know about it- too late! Anyway the beds are really comfy and showers are great. The first room I was in was a little noisy at first but I was so tired that it didn't bother me. I wont go in to too much detail about the dramas on my second visit but there was a problem with my booking apparently and despite my showing evidence (email confirmation from agoda) of exactly what I had booked the staff were insisting that had to either pay extra money or leave... We had bad luck with this one. Booked for 5 nights and after 4 days of a string of ongoing issues we tapped out and booked somewhere else. Moral of the story if you dont have time to read the rest of the review below is that there are plenty of better, cleaner places in Bali where the staff will truly go the extra mile to make every part of your stay extra special! Rooms are spacious, but not well maintained. From door locks and safety deposit boxes not working to toilets clogging up and the smell of sewage engulfing the room when the aircon is left off. This place has potential, but in my opinion ruined by the lack of attention to detail. Our room had not been cleaned for 2 days. The same mess we saw when we came into the room, was there two days later – despite complaining. Dishes, glasses and cutlery from room service dot the floors of the hotel and aren’t picked up promptly. We ordered room service and the dishes were still on the floor in front of our room a day later being mauled by ants. We wasted a lot of time waiting for maintenance people to fix things in our room so we could use the basic amenities. The balcony was exceptionally dirty. Breakfast is interesting. The quality of food is poor. We had young teens serve breakfast in an appalling manor. Ask for two sunny-side eggs and you get an egg-pancake with exploded yoke seeping over your plate. There is no care given to service in the restaurant. Breakfast ends at 10:30 but if you haven’t gotten in by 9:30 you risk getting the remnants of the service with no opportunity for them to replace what’s on the buffet menu for the day. On the last day there seemed to be a change of staff and the restaurant just worked better. Quality of output improved, but it was a little too late for us. When eventually we decid Show more Sebastien , Malta Visesa Ubud Resort 9.1 Exceptional Based on 149 reviews From the moment we arrived, the staff was friendly and wanted to make sure we enjoyed our stay. The property is beautiful. The villas with private pools, lush green plants everywhere, organic gardens, beautiful temple on property, tours and activities, ducks/cows/roosters, nice public pool and fountains, bar, delicious food, relaxing spa...all of it was wonderful!! Breakfast every morning was great, with a combination of buffet items and fresh ordered items too. Coffees were fresh and they also have fresh juices. Daily room cleaning, pool cleaning and turndown service were all great, and the staff were all friendly. We had our laundry done multiple times, and it always came back on time, clean, smelled great and folded nicely. It was a little pricey, but convenient and easy. The spa is located in the rice fields in beautiful cabanas, and the cafe with healthy drinks is a great addition to the relaxing experience. I had a massage and facial on a rainy afternoon, and highly recommend. The staff make sure you're comfortable and the products they use were fantastic! They have a nice outside gym and yoga mats too. The wifi is good throughout the property, but we had some issues with it in our villa. It would still work great in the cabana area, but sometimes would stop working in the bedroom. They have activities throughout the day, and I'd recommend the poolside pampering and the class to learn how to make Balinese offerings. They have a free shuttle to take you into Ubud city every two hours, which was convenient and easy to use. We highly recommend staying here, as it has been a wonderful experience and definitely the best hotel we've ever stayed at!! Thank you for a wonderful week, Royal Tulip Vesesa! Show more Kiel , United States Griya Santrian a Beach Resort 8.4 Excellent Based on 870 reviews The majority of the Sanur hotels and resorts were built 25 to 50 years ago and Girya Santrain was built in 1970’s however it’s been updated several times since but the rooms still have a dated atmosphere. The reason I mention this is because the majority of the beach front hotels in Sanur can’t be compared with the more modern hotels rooms elsewhere in Bali. It’s context, Sanur with its white sand and peaceful atmosphere is different to the hectic pace of the Kuta, Legian, Seminyak side where the hotels are more modern. Griya Santrain would be one the better beach front hotel/resorts with several pools, the pool bar looks like lots of fun and with direct access to the beach it a great spot. The gardens are well established and beautiful. A dated but a decent sized bathroom with separate shower and bathtub which is a blessing, the need to not get into the bathtub to have shower was certainly appreciated. Very comfortable bed and a selection of pillows with quality linen. Perfect! The “Pool View” room was great, but if you wanted peace and quiet I imagine the Garden View rooms would suit. The hotel restaurant set right on the beach is very nice however I think the hotel management should increase the budget of the kitchen… if you get my meaning. Breakfast, I guess it could be classed as equivalent to 3 star hotel. The morning coffee is either the brewed style or AUD$4.20 extra for a cappuccino which is equally as bad… skip the coffee and go to one of the other beach front hotels with a trained barista at the machine. In general, the food is below par of what is served elsewhere in Bali, why management doesn’t improve the situation is astonishing. They have good, friendly capable staff, the perfect location therefore why not make it the point of difference between other eateries in Sanur? Send the kitchen staff to some of the places in Seminyak. For breakfast and lunch “The Nook”, for dinner there are too many to mention. People do pay for a great meal and also retur Show more Marcel , Australia Bounty Hotel 7.4 Very good Based on 849 reviews I had an amazing time at the Bounty. Definitely for the young at heart as the music was constantly pumping and the drinks were flowing. But I loved that and although situated directly next to the pool, it was never too loud. I met an elderly lady there from Victoria who was definitely young at heart and appeared to enjoy the atmosphere. So it seems anyone can enjoy. One thing I wasn't pleased about was that my tattoo designs were thrown out. They were on my bedside table and when asked if they knew where they were or what happened to them they denied ever seeing them. A lesson learnt I guess. That aside I would recommend this hotel to anyone. A great place to meet people, centrally located and more than value for money. Btw if you want a great place to hang out, check out the small little bar across from the bounty. Serves great food and the guy who runs it "mad dog" always greets you with a smile and a card trick. It's on the opposite of the street from the Bounty! Show more Jason , Australia Sulis Beach Hotel and Spa 8.7 Excellent Based on 190 reviews Sulis worked really well for us as we were looking for a place which could accomodate our family of 4 in one room. The room was large, spacious and clean and fitted with modern amenities. My husband was very pleased with the amount of plug points available making it very convenient to charge phones, laptops etc. The bathroom was large and what I liked was that there was even a soap dispenser next to the toilet. The fridge was large and could accomodate alot. I was impressed most by the management and staff of the hotel as they went out of their way to accomodate every request and were very prompt in replying all correspondence. The breakfast was a set menu but had 3 options of American, Continental and Indonesian. The food was tasty and there was ample to eat. The only suggestions I would make would be to have some covering or sun umbrellas over the pool side lounging chairs as it was very hot on the roof top and to have an iron made available when needed in the room. Show more Adele , Sri Lanka Tijili Hotel Seminyak 8.8 Excellent Based on 627 reviews Stayed in the deluxe room with balcony for 5 nights in Mar 2017. The photo of the hotel is really as per what is provided by the managment, bright and quirky. Is situated behind Courtyard Marriot hotel. The hotel looks new, rooms are spacious and clean with reasonably good wifi. There is a safe box in the room, mini fridge, free coffee and tea, slippers, bathrobes and 2 bottles of water provided daily. The breakfast is good, sufficient spread for those who want western or eastern selection, with slight changes made daily to the spread. Had dinner at the hotel as well, and can say the food is reasonably good. Staff are friendly and speaks reasonably good english and they acceded my request for late checkout, as my flight was in the evening. The hotel provides free transport at 9am, 1pm and 5pm (i think) to Seminyak beach or end of JL Drupadi. I personally do not find the location of the hotel good, as there are not much food choices near the hotel. The attractions and beach are not too close as well, so maybe the hotel should provide more timing for the free transport service. Overall, I would stay again if there are no better options in terms of location and price. Show more Wendy , Singapore Ulun Ubud Resort 9.1 Exceptional Based on 246 reviews I still can't get over this place....!!!! That's an impact that Ulun Ubud has left on us!!! A romantic abode for nature lovers, when you get up to see green mountains in-front of you, sounds of the river water flowing and openess all around. And cherry on the cake is when you have amazing staff to take care of the finest details from room cleanliness to serving us with breakfast of our choice to preparing day plans with suggestions or dropping us to the city centre. As an architect, the entire experience of how every unit in the resort has been placed and the excitement that builds within you with as to what is next is the beauty of this place. PRO’s: 01. Amazing Staff with a 24hr smile 02. Elaborate Breakfast that can kill your appetite for Lunch 03. Huge room with a well-designed bathroom 04. Front Balcony with sitting overlooking the mountains and the sounds of the river 05. Amazing levels leaving you with surprises on every turn. CON’s: 01. Swimming Pool could have been slightly bigger. (That’s the only negative aspect that refrains Ulun Ubud to be a five star property) Kudos to the entire team at Ulun Ubud for great service & hospitality. Show more Nishita , India HARRIS Hotel Seminyak 8.2 Excellent Based on 1089 reviews I stayed here on a company gathering event, so we didn't do much in the hotel. The room was OK, typical colorful Harris hotel. The bathroom was small, and the shower partition is not all the way so the whole bathroom would likely to get wet each time someone showers. We could hear the room next door from the bathroom clearly, so that is something that I am not too comfortable with. We didn't have breakfast there, but the restaurant area seems OK. The pool looks nice although we didn't use it. It is quite a walk from the main road where all the restaurants and shops are located. I reckon it is a good 25 minutes walk to Seminyak Square. Looking back, I am not sure it is a good value for money considering the distance we have to go in order to get to all the dining and main road. Show more andhika , Indonesia Courtyard by Marriott Bali Seminyak 8.7 Excellent Based on 573 reviews First impression looks like a mass-scale hotel for large tour groups from hell. It was certainly the case on my first day as some sort of multi-level marketing organisation organised their annual trip to reward their high achievers or something like that. They had dinner events with loud music at the pool on my first night. It wasn’t easy to sleep. The room was decent size, enough to put two medium bags for two adult travellers. Aircond works superbly fine but the shower system wasn’t good - may be it was just low water pressure or the system brand wasn’t Grohe. There was also no large mirror by the sink but there is a small mirror on the side. The bed was decent and better than the other hotel I stayed earlier. Breakfast selection was very good and they had one of the best bagels I had for some time. I had the bagel everyday sometimes with poached egg. As a Muslim, I dislike having the pork dishes served side by side with the rest but I guess Bali is like another country when it comes to religion in Indonesia. The hotel is just a few minutes walk to the Double Six beach which is a popular hangout. The hotel has a regular shuttle service to the beach. I rented a motorbike from a roadside shop right across to the hotel on Drupadi road. Don’t pay more than 50k rupiah per day if u staying more than 3 days. I even used the bike to go to Ubud for a day and it wasn’t all that bad. The pool was a good size but a hotel of this size probably need a larger space on the poolside. Everyday I could not get any sunbath-bed by the poolside so ended up going to the beach instead. It wasn’t a peak season so I guess it will be harder to get a good pool side spot during peak times. Overall it was a good hotel to stay. I probably won’t stay here again so soon but if i want a nice cosy and compact hotel with good food and short distance to the beach, I would come here. Show more Nor , Malaysia Kejora Suites - Designer Boutique Hotel 8.9 Excellent Based on 351 reviews We really enjoyed our stay here and looking back, I think we should have spent more time in Sanur than in Seminyak (this was our first time to Bali). We stayed in a Deluxe suite on level 2 where our balcony overlooked the pool. The room was spacious, clean and with good aircon. The coffee espresso machine was a novelty which we took full advantage of. The resort restaurant was great and serves a great variety food, mainly western though. For breakfast, you get to select a meal from the menu, and there are fresh fruits, breads and pastries to help yourself to as well. We went in the off season, so the hotel was not busy, which meant the pool was not busy. However, when there are people in it, you can hear them if they are talking loudly or yelling. Another great thing is Kejora has a sister hotel - Segara Village Hotel located a 5minute walk along the beach. It is much bigger and has beautiful gardens and multiple swimming pools. Therefore if Kejora pool is busy, go here. The Sanur beach at the back is nothing spectacular, however a clear sky sunrise is a treat to watch (if you're awake at 6am). Show more Altundal ,Australia Discover the neighborhoods of Bali Seminyak 4407 hotels Ubud 3600 hotels Canggu 1728 hotels Uluwatu 1066 hotels Sanur 1008 hotels Kuta 976 hotels Legian 739 hotels Nusa Dua 557 hotels Jimbaran 535 hotels Denpasar 519 hotels Nusa Lembongan 454 hotels Tabanan 269 hotels Tanah Lot 157 hotels Keramas 145 hotels Sidemen 79 hotels Seririt 62 hotels Padang Bai 43 hotels Nusa Ceningan 38 hotels Bangli 26 hotels Gianyar 21 hotels Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Guest Houses in Bali 2253 Resorts in Bali 1103 Apartments in Bali 880 Bungalows in Bali 240 Hostels in Bali 185 Serviced Apartments in Bali 47 Villas in Bali 22 Capsule Hotels in Bali 9 Love Hotels in Bali 1 More about Bali Bali is a world away from the rest of Indonesia, and a longtime favorite with international travelers. Surfers have been coming here since the 1930s, but it wasn't until the 1960s that surfing vacations to Bali became the popular thing to do. Today, the trend continues and Bali sees as many surfers as it does affluent resort tourists. Indonesia may have the world's largest Muslim population, but Bali fosters its own distinct culture. Hinduism has flourished here for nearly 2,000 years. Away from the beaches are fascinating Hindu temples, cultural exhibitions, terraced rice fields, and colorful festivals. Kuta is the busiest resort district in Bali, featuring some of the top luxury hotels in Bali. Behind the main waterfront is a spread of budget guesthouses that are still within easy walking distance of the beach. From here it's a short trip by taxi or rented motorbike to Uluwatu , a massive limestone peninsula jutting out in the sea. Tourists visit Uluwatu to see the temple, go surfing, or watch the sunset over the majestic cliffs. Legian is another must-see, as it offers an excellent surf along with exciting nightlife along the beach. Life in Legian begins and ends on the beach. Surf shops give lessons by day, and then give way to lively bars and live music venues after sunset. There is a reason that Bali is often referred to as paradise, and much of it is evidenced by a visit to the many beaches.
